context_of_use: The manager authorizes or rejects orders as part of the order approval workflow.
description: Authorize or reject orders as part of the order approval workflow.
triggering_event: Manager initiates the order approval process.
preconditions: Manager is logged into the system.
postconditions: Orders are either approved or rejected.
Order status is updated in the system.
assumptions: The manager has the necessary permissions to approve orders.
The system has a mechanism to display orders pending approval.
requirements_met: The system shall allow the manager to approve or reject orders.
The system shall update the order status based on the manager's decision.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the criteria for approving or rejecting orders.
main_flow: 1. Manager selects an order to approve → System displays order details.
2. Manager reviews the order details → System allows manager to approve or reject the order.
3. Manager approves the order → System updates the order status to 'Approved'.
4. System notifies the customer of the order approval.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): If the order details are incomplete, then the system prompts the manager to review the missing information.
